title: Making the most of Integral
text:
Using Integral to catch up
Students miss lessons for a whole number of reasons. Maybe a music lesson, illness, a sports game, etc.
Integral has you covered.

How to catch up

Find our from a classmate or your teacher what you missed in the lesson
Find the relevant section of Integral







Tip!



When in the correct course, use the ‘Topics’ menu button to see the whole course broken into topics and chapters



Go to the learn section and find the video covering the topic you missed. Every topic of A level maths and further maths is covered in a teaching video.

Watch this video to see this in action:

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
In this section, you will find resources to develop the thinking needed for this chapter:

Skillpacks
Exercises - Level 1 (and full worked solutions)

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
In this section, you will find questions to push you beyond the level expected. You will need to think and reason at a high level but these questions will leave you at a higher level of understanding.

Exercise - Level 3 (and full worked solutions)

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
Making the most of Integral
This website is for anybody who uses Integral - MEI’s online learning platform for A level maths and further maths.






How did you get here?



If you happen to have landed on this page and don’t know what Integral is, go and have a look at the Integral website for more details and to book a tour of the product if you’re interested!


In the menu bar you can find links to our dedicated ‘Help/FAQ’ section as well as our ‘Roadmap’ highlighting upcoming changes and improvements.
The website is split into two user groups - Student and Teacher.
Please choose which type of user you are to continue!

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
In this section, you will find the tools for the learning pat of the chapter. You will see:

Interactive books
Notes and Examples
Walkthroughs
Teaching videos

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
Using Integral to learn new topics
Integral isn’t just about catching up with missed lessons or revising for tests. You can also use Integral to teach yourself new topics or courses that will help to round off your understanding and foundation of knowledge.
When might you want to learn something new?

You want to learn some further maths

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
Maybe you have homework due. Maybe it is coming up to a test or a mock exam. Maybe it’s nearly the summer exams……
Whatever the time of year, practice is the most important thing to do to get better at maths. You simply can not improve your maths by just reading.
Integral has you covered.
There are several options within Integral when you want to practise your maths.


These are one of the newer additions to our A level maths resources. These books are designed to introduce a topic but they also make wonderful revision books. They have lots of different types of interactive questions throughout each book; all giving instant feedback when you answer them.



You won’t find these in every section. However, throughout AS maths you will see them in the develop section. They are designed to give you examples of skill based questions and provide unlimited practice and feedback as you go.



Throughout the topics you will find up to three levels of exercise. Each of them comes with full worked solutions so you can see line-by-line how the questions were answered.


These are a great place to practise the fundamentals of the topic.



These are designed to get you to an exam level of understanding.



These questions have been created to push your understanding of the topic to the max.




Every chapter has a specifically written online test. They are all self-marking for instant feedback on what was right and wrong. These can be difficult but have been designed to get you exam ready. You will need to have pen and paper (and calculator!) at the ready for all your workings as you will only put the answer into Integral.



Every topic comes with a topic assessment with marks ranging from 30 to 60. These are a challenging test of all you know from the chapters of the topic. As a student, you do not have access to the worked solutions so you may need to speak to your teacher about how best to use these assessments.

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
In this section, you will find resources to progress your understanding to an exam-level:

Crucial points
Exercises - Level 2 (and full worked solutions)
Online self-marked assessment

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
Using Integral as a student
Integral can be your one-stop shop for A level maths. As a student, you have access to traditional style notes and examples, teaching videos, interactive books, leveled exercises, online self-marking tests and much, much more.






Watch out for tips!



This guide has lots of tips to help that look like this :-)


Each topic in Integral is split into chapters. Each chapter is split up into different sections. Click on a section to see more details of what resources you can access.



























Alternatively, choose an option below to see how to use Integral in different scenarios.
I want to use Integral to:

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
Using Integral as a teacher
Integral can be all you need to teach A level maths.
The true power of Integral comes from students having individual accounts but that means you need to be mindful of what they can access. This will be discussed in each option below.






Watch out for tips!



This guide has lots of tips to help that look like this :-)


Choose a scenario below to see how to use Integral to help with your teaching.

title: Making the most of Integral
text:
The Integral roadmap
Here you can see what we are working on now and in the future. You can also request new things and vote for current ideas that you would like to see implemented.
